column4: So my just-installed Ubuntu 10.04 shows a blank screen instead of running X.  If I enter in rescue mode in the grub menu and then FailSafeX, then it works.  What should I do now to have a working X Windows by default when I boot?  Thank you.
what is your graphics chip/board?
I don't know.  How can I find it?
lspci | grep VGA
pdk: $ lspci | grep VGA
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Bugs/Lucidi8xxFreezes you have 855 which is problematic in lucid. The new fix at the top looks proming though.
thank youu
the workaround is to add "i915.modeset=1" to grub line, but crashes still seem to happen without the "potential solution
shouldn't I try the potential solution with the PPA packages first?
sure, but you may need to used add  "i915.modeset=1" to grub (holding shift and adding on a single boot) just to get in enough to proceed with the fix. I personally would head straight for the fix.
adding the Intel driver repo worked.  Now I'm confused about adding the 855gm PPA too or not.  Why should I?  Or should not?  Also, should I use the Workaround A anyway?

because i get the impression that the first driver is just one with the KMS enabled ("i915.modeset=1"), and the second one actaully has the patches that fix the problems. [The workaround KMS/modeset/first-driver will get things working OK, but people experience crashes and random problems even still]
OK. So your advise is 1st driver + 2nd driver + workaround A, right?
No. The total solution is just the section "Potential Solution: PPA packages".
before that section was added, workaround A was the best solution. It does not sound like you have applied or need to apply the workaounds at all.
Ok, thanks.
in fact, for "Potential Solution: PPA packages" to work, the workaround must be UNDONE.
Crystal clear now :-)
